thread.title: Boojum launches new plant-based, meat-free menu item for limited time
thread.title_full: Boojum launches new plant-based, meat-free menu item for limited time

title: Boojum launches new plant-based, meat-free menu item for limited time
text: The limited edition dish packed with Boojum flavours has been rolled out this week and will be in stock for January irishmirror.ie - Jan 05 2024 - 45 - 2762 Views Boojum has launched a tasty new plant-based, meat-free alternative as part of its 2024 Veganuary campaign. Modelled off the traditional Latin American dish, Mock Carne Asada is rich, sweet, and smoky and, in a Boojum first, is paired with their new Guajillo Chilli dipping sauce. The limited-edition dish has been rolled out this week across stores in Ireland and will only be available for Boojum fanatics during January. READ MORE: Popular Mexican food joint, Boojum, will give away 15,000 burritos to students this week The Irish-owned company has once again teamed up with UK-based, meat-free alternative, Mock, for the second year running following on from the huge success of their original collaboration last year with Mock Alt-Pastor, which proved so popular it became a permanent fixture on the menu. Mock Beef has been carefully curated to ensure that it tastes just like the real thing, and paired with the new Guajillo Chilli dipping sauce, it comes packed with all the traditional big, bold, Boojum flavours. The new sauce sees the company put their spin on the new viral food craze that has taken TikTok and Instagram by storm – the coveted dipping pot. This medium-heat dipping sauce is included in every Mock Carne Asada meal and can also be added to any other main meal. Paul McCullagh, Head of Marketing, said, “Every Veganuary, we challenge ourselves to release a product that is vegan -friendly but still has all the taste and flavours that pack the same punch as our traditional meat options. “Two of our three previous Veganuary products have made their way to our permanent menu due to unprecedented demand by veggies and non-veggies alike. “This is something we are very proud of, and it tells us that the blend of ingredients our chefs carefully curate to make our vegan products taste just like traditional Mexican dishes, really do work. “As well as the launch of our delicious Mock Carne Asada, we are also excited to launch our Guajillo Chilli dipping sauce, a first for us and the perfect addition to any Boojum order. The messier the better, I say! “As we see the popularity of Veganuary start to dwindle with other major food companies, we remain committed to delivering delicious vegan products and options for Boojum fans, while still helping protect the planet and change perceptions on plant-based produce!” Join the Irish Mirror’s breaking news service on WhatsApp. Click this link to receive breaking news and the latest headlines direct to your phone.
